trans-unit.source: How to Deploy the Access Panel Extension for Internet Explorer using Group Policy | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: How to Deploy the Access Panel Extension for Internet Explorer using Group Policy | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: How to use group policy to deploy the Internet Explorer add-on for the My Apps portal.
trans-unit.target: How to use group policy to deploy the Internet Explorer add-on for the My Apps portal.

trans-unit.source: How to Deploy the Access Panel Extension for Internet Explorer using Group Policy
trans-unit.target: How to Deploy the Access Panel Extension for Internet Explorer using Group Policy

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows how to use group policy to remotely install the Access Panel extension for Internet Explorer on your users' machines.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows how to use group policy to remotely install the Access Panel extension for Internet Explorer on your users' machines.

trans-unit.source: This extension is required for Internet Explorer users who need to sign into apps that are configured using [password-based single sign-on](active-directory-appssoaccess-whatis.md#password-based-single-sign-on).
trans-unit.target: This extension is required for Internet Explorer users who need to sign into apps that are configured using [password-based single sign-on](active-directory-appssoaccess-whatis.md#password-based-single-sign-on).

trans-unit.source: It is recommended that admins automate the deployment of this extension.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended that admins automate the deployment of this extension.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, users will have to download and install the extension themselves, which is prone to user error and requires administrator permissions.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, users will have to download and install the extension themselves, which is prone to user error and requires administrator permissions.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial covers one method of automating software deployments by using group policy.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial covers one method of automating software deployments by using group policy.

trans-unit.source: Learn more about group policy.
trans-unit.target: Learn more about group policy.

trans-unit.source: The Access Panel extension is also available for [Chrome](https://go.microsoft.com/fwLink/?LinkID=311859) and [Firefox](https://go.microsoft.com/fwLink/?LinkID=626998), neither of which require administrator permissions to install.
trans-unit.target: The Access Panel extension is also available for [Chrome](https://go.microsoft.com/fwLink/?LinkID=311859) and [Firefox](https://go.microsoft.com/fwLink/?LinkID=626998), neither of which require administrator permissions to install.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: You have set up [Active Directory Domain Services](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/aa362244%28v=vs.85%29.aspx), and you have joined your users' machines to your domain.
trans-unit.target: You have set up [Active Directory Domain Services](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/aa362244%28v=vs.85%29.aspx), and you have joined your users' machines to your domain.

trans-unit.source: You must have the "Edit settings" permission in order to edit Group Policy Objects (GPOs).
trans-unit.target: You must have the "Edit settings" permission in order to edit Group Policy Objects (GPOs).

trans-unit.source: By default, members of the following security groups have this permission: Domain Administrators, Enterprise Administrators, and Group Policy Creator Owners.
trans-unit.target: By default, members of the following security groups have this permission: Domain Administrators, Enterprise Administrators, and Group Policy Creator Owners.

trans-unit.source: Learn more.
trans-unit.target: Learn more.

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Create the Distribution Point
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Create the Distribution Point

trans-unit.source: First, you must place the installer package on a network location that can be accessed from all of the machines that you wish to remotely install the extension on.
trans-unit.target: First, you must place the installer package on a network location that can be accessed from all of the machines that you wish to remotely install the extension on.

trans-unit.source: To do this, follow these steps:
trans-unit.target: To do this, follow these steps:

trans-unit.source: Log on to the server as an administrator
trans-unit.target: Log on to the server as an administrator

trans-unit.source: In the **Server Manager** window, go to **Files and Storage Services**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Server Manager** window, go to **Files and Storage Services**.

trans-unit.source: Open Files and Storage Services
trans-unit.target: Open Files and Storage Services

trans-unit.source: Go to the **Shares** tab.
trans-unit.target: Go to the **Shares** tab.

trans-unit.source: Then click on **Tasks** > **New Share...**
trans-unit.target: Then click on **Tasks** > **New Share...**

trans-unit.source: Open Files and Storage Services
trans-unit.target: Open Files and Storage Services

trans-unit.source: Complete the **New Share Wizard** and set permissions to ensure that it can be accessed from your users' machines.
trans-unit.target: Complete the **New Share Wizard** and set permissions to ensure that it can be accessed from your users' machines.

trans-unit.source: Learn more about shares.
trans-unit.target: Learn more about shares.

trans-unit.source: Download the following Microsoft Windows Installer package (.msi file): [Access Panel Extension.msi](https://account.activedirectory.windowsazure.com/Applications/Installers/x64/Access Panel Extension.msi)
trans-unit.target: Download the following Microsoft Windows Installer package (.msi file): [Access Panel Extension.msi](https://account.activedirectory.windowsazure.com/Applications/Installers/x64/Access Panel Extension.msi)

trans-unit.source: Copy the installer package to a desired location on the share.
trans-unit.target: Copy the installer package to a desired location on the share.

trans-unit.source: Copy the .msi file to your the share.
trans-unit.target: Copy the .msi file to your the share.

trans-unit.source: Verify that your client machines are able to access the installer package from the share.
trans-unit.target: Verify that your client machines are able to access the installer package from the share.

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Create the Group Policy Object
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Create the Group Policy Object

trans-unit.source: Log on to the server that hosts your Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS) installation.
trans-unit.target: Log on to the server that hosts your Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS) installation.

trans-unit.source: In the Server Manager, go to **Tools** > **Group Policy Management**.
trans-unit.target: In the Server Manager, go to **Tools** > **Group Policy Management**.

trans-unit.source: Go to Tools > Group Policy Managment
trans-unit.target: Go to Tools > Group Policy Managment

trans-unit.source: In the left pane of the **Group Policy Management** window, view your Organizational Unit (OU) hierarchy and determine at which scope you would like to apply the group policy.
trans-unit.target: In the left pane of the **Group Policy Management** window, view your Organizational Unit (OU) hierarchy and determine at which scope you would like to apply the group policy.

trans-unit.source: For instance, you may decide to pick a small OU to deploy to a few users for testing, or you may pick a top-level OU to deploy to your entire organization.
trans-unit.target: For instance, you may decide to pick a small OU to deploy to a few users for testing, or you may pick a top-level OU to deploy to your entire organization.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you would like to create or edit your Organization Units (OUs), switch back to the Server Manager and go to **Tools** > **Active Directory Users and Computers**.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you would like to create or edit your Organization Units (OUs), switch back to the Server Manager and go to **Tools** > **Active Directory Users and Computers**.

trans-unit.source: Once you have selected an OU, right-click on it and select **Create a GPO in this domain, and Link it here...**
trans-unit.target: Once you have selected an OU, right-click on it and select **Create a GPO in this domain, and Link it here...**

trans-unit.source: Create a new GPO
trans-unit.target: Create a new GPO

trans-unit.source: In the **New GPO** prompt, type in a name for the new Group Policy Object.
trans-unit.target: In the **New GPO** prompt, type in a name for the new Group Policy Object.

trans-unit.source: Name the new GPO
trans-unit.target: Name the new GPO

trans-unit.source: Right-click on the Group Policy Object that you just created, and select **Edit**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click on the Group Policy Object that you just created, and select **Edit**.

trans-unit.source: Edit the new GPO
trans-unit.target: Edit the new GPO

trans-unit.source: Step 3: Assign the Installation Package
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Assign the Installation Package

trans-unit.source: Determine whether you would like to deploy the extension based on **Computer Configuration** or **User Configuration**.
trans-unit.target: Determine whether you would like to deploy the extension based on **Computer Configuration** or **User Configuration**.

trans-unit.source: When using [computer configuration](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/cc736413%28v=ws.10%29.aspx), the extension will be installed on the computer regardless of which users log on to it.
trans-unit.target: When using [computer configuration](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/cc736413%28v=ws.10%29.aspx), the extension will be installed on the computer regardless of which users log on to it.

trans-unit.source: On the other hand, with [user configuration](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/cc781953%28v=ws.10%29.aspx), users will have the extension installed for them regardless of which computers they log on to.
trans-unit.target: On the other hand, with [user configuration](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/cc781953%28v=ws.10%29.aspx), users will have the extension installed for them regardless of which computers they log on to.

trans-unit.source: In the left pane of the **Group Policy Management Editor** window, go to either of the following folder paths, depending on which type of configuration you chose:
trans-unit.target: In the left pane of the **Group Policy Management Editor** window, go to either of the following folder paths, depending on which type of configuration you chose:

trans-unit.source: Right-click on **Software installation**, then select **New** > **Package...**
trans-unit.target: Right-click on **Software installation**, then select **New** > **Package...**

trans-unit.source: Create a new software installation package
trans-unit.target: Create a new software installation package

trans-unit.source: Go to the shared folder that contains the installer package from [Step 1: Create the Distribution Point](#step-1-create-the-distribution-point), select the .msi file, and click **Open**.
trans-unit.target: Go to the shared folder that contains the installer package from [Step 1: Create the Distribution Point](#step-1-create-the-distribution-point), select the .msi file, and click **Open**.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] If the share is located on this same server, verify that you are accessing the .msi through the network file path, rather than the local file path.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] If the share is located on this same server, verify that you are accessing the .msi through the network file path, rather than the local file path.

trans-unit.source: Select the installation package from the shared folder.
trans-unit.target: Select the installation package from the shared folder.

trans-unit.source: In the **Deploy Software** prompt, select **Assigned** for your deployment method.
trans-unit.target: In the **Deploy Software** prompt, select **Assigned** for your deployment method.

trans-unit.source: Then click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Then click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: Select Assigned, then click OK.
trans-unit.target: Select Assigned, then click OK.

trans-unit.source: The extension is now deployed to the OU that you selected.
trans-unit.target: The extension is now deployed to the OU that you selected.

trans-unit.source: Learn more about Group Policy Software Installation.
trans-unit.target: Learn more about Group Policy Software Installation.

trans-unit.source: Step 4: Auto-Enable the Extension for Internet Explorer
trans-unit.target: Step 4: Auto-Enable the Extension for Internet Explorer

trans-unit.source: In addition to running the installer, every extension for Internet Explorer must be explicitly enabled before it can be used.
trans-unit.target: In addition to running the installer, every extension for Internet Explorer must be explicitly enabled before it can be used.

trans-unit.source: Follow the steps below to enable the Access Panel Extension using group policy:
trans-unit.target: Follow the steps below to enable the Access Panel Extension using group policy:

trans-unit.source: In the **Group Policy Management Editor** window, go to either of the following paths, depending on which type of configuration you chose in [Step 3: Assign the Installation Package](#step-3-assign-the-installation-package):
trans-unit.target: In the **Group Policy Management Editor** window, go to either of the following paths, depending on which type of configuration you chose in [Step 3: Assign the Installation Package](#step-3-assign-the-installation-package):

trans-unit.source: Right-click on **Add-on List**, and select **Edit**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click on **Add-on List**, and select **Edit**.

trans-unit.source: ![Edit Add-on List.](./media/active-directory-saas-ie-group-policy/edit-add-on-list.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Edit Add-on List.](./media/active-directory-saas-ie-group-policy/edit-add-on-list.png)

trans-unit.source: In the **Add-on List** window, select **Enabled**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Add-on List** window, select **Enabled**.

trans-unit.source: Then, under the **Options** section, click **Show...**.
trans-unit.target: Then, under the **Options** section, click **Show...**.

trans-unit.source: Click Enable, then click Show...
trans-unit.target: Click Enable, then click Show...

trans-unit.source: In the **Show Contents** window, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the **Show Contents** window, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: For the first column (the **Value Name** field), copy and paste the following Class ID: `{030E9A3F-7B18-4122-9A60-B87235E4F59E}`
trans-unit.target: For the first column (the **Value Name** field), copy and paste the following Class ID: `{030E9A3F-7B18-4122-9A60-B87235E4F59E}`

trans-unit.source: For the second column (the **Value** field), type in the following value: `1`
trans-unit.target: For the second column (the **Value** field), type in the following value: `1`

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** to close the **Show Contents** window.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** to close the **Show Contents** window.

trans-unit.source: Fill out the values as specified above.
trans-unit.target: Fill out the values as specified above.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** to apply your changes and close the **Add-on List** window.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** to apply your changes and close the **Add-on List** window.

trans-unit.source: The extension should now be enabled for the machines in the selected OU.
trans-unit.target: The extension should now be enabled for the machines in the selected OU.

trans-unit.source: Learn more about using group policy to enable or disable Internet Explorer add-ons.
trans-unit.target: Learn more about using group policy to enable or disable Internet Explorer add-ons.

trans-unit.source: Step 5 (Optional): Disable "Remember Password" Prompt
trans-unit.target: Step 5 (Optional): Disable "Remember Password" Prompt

trans-unit.source: When users sign-in to websites using the Access Panel Extension, Internet Explorer may show the following prompt asking "Would you like to store your password?"
trans-unit.target: When users sign-in to websites using the Access Panel Extension, Internet Explorer may show the following prompt asking "Would you like to store your password?"

trans-unit.source: If you wish to prevent your users from seeing this prompt, then follow the steps below to prevent auto-complete from remembering passwords:
trans-unit.target: If you wish to prevent your users from seeing this prompt, then follow the steps below to prevent auto-complete from remembering passwords:

trans-unit.source: In the **Group Policy Management Editor** window, go to the path listed below.
trans-unit.target: In the **Group Policy Management Editor** window, go to the path listed below.

trans-unit.source: Note that this configuration setting is only available under **User Configuration**.
trans-unit.target: Note that this configuration setting is only available under **User Configuration**.

trans-unit.source: Find the setting named **Turn on the auto-complete feature for user names and passwords on forms**.
trans-unit.target: Find the setting named **Turn on the auto-complete feature for user names and passwords on forms**.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Previous versions of Active Directory may list this setting with the name **Do not allow auto-complete to save passwords**.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Previous versions of Active Directory may list this setting with the name **Do not allow auto-complete to save passwords**.

trans-unit.source: The configuration for that setting differs from the setting described in this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: The configuration for that setting differs from the setting described in this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Remember to look for this under User Settings.
trans-unit.target: Remember to look for this under User Settings.

trans-unit.source: Right click on the above setting, and select **Edit**.
trans-unit.target: Right click on the above setting, and select **Edit**.

trans-unit.source: In the window titled **Turn on the auto-complete feature for user names and passwords on forms**, select **Disabled**.
trans-unit.target: In the window titled **Turn on the auto-complete feature for user names and passwords on forms**, select **Disabled**.

trans-unit.source: Select Disable
trans-unit.target: Select Disable

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** to apply these changes and close the window.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** to apply these changes and close the window.

trans-unit.source: Users will no longer be able to store their credentials or use auto-complete to access previously stored credentials.
trans-unit.target: Users will no longer be able to store their credentials or use auto-complete to access previously stored credentials.

trans-unit.source: However, this policy does allow users to continue to use auto-complete for other types of form fields, such as search fields.
trans-unit.target: However, this policy does allow users to continue to use auto-complete for other types of form fields, such as search fields.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.WARNING] If this policy is enabled after users have chosen to store some credentials, this policy will *not* clear the credentials that have already been stored.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.WARNING] If this policy is enabled after users have chosen to store some credentials, this policy will *not* clear the credentials that have already been stored.

trans-unit.source: Step 6: Testing the Deployment
trans-unit.target: Step 6: Testing the Deployment

trans-unit.source: Follow the steps below to verify if the extension deployment was successful:
trans-unit.target: Follow the steps below to verify if the extension deployment was successful:

trans-unit.source: If you deployed using **Computer Configuration**, sign into a client machine that belongs to the OU that you selected in [Step 2: Create the Group Policy Object](#step-2-create-the-group-policy-object).
trans-unit.target: If you deployed using **Computer Configuration**, sign into a client machine that belongs to the OU that you selected in [Step 2: Create the Group Policy Object](#step-2-create-the-group-policy-object).

trans-unit.source: If you deployed using **User Configuration**, make sure to sign in as a user who belongs to that OU.
trans-unit.target: If you deployed using **User Configuration**, make sure to sign in as a user who belongs to that OU.

trans-unit.source: It may take a couple sign ins for the group policy changes to fully update with this machine.
trans-unit.target: It may take a couple sign ins for the group policy changes to fully update with this machine.

trans-unit.source: To force the update, open a **Command Prompt** window and run the following command: `gpupdate /force`
trans-unit.target: To force the update, open a **Command Prompt** window and run the following command: `gpupdate /force`

trans-unit.source: You will need to restart the machine for the installation to take place.
trans-unit.target: You will need to restart the machine for the installation to take place.

trans-unit.source: Bootup may take significantly more time than usual while the extension installs.
trans-unit.target: Bootup may take significantly more time than usual while the extension installs.

trans-unit.source: After restarting, open **Internet Explorer**.
trans-unit.target: After restarting, open **Internet Explorer**.

trans-unit.source: On the upper-right corner of the window, click on **Tools** (the gear icon), and then select **Manage add-ons**.
trans-unit.target: On the upper-right corner of the window, click on **Tools** (the gear icon), and then select **Manage add-ons**.

trans-unit.source: Go to Tools > Manage Add-Ons
trans-unit.target: Go to Tools > Manage Add-Ons

trans-unit.source: In the **Manage Add-ons** window, verify that the **Access Panel Extension** has been installed and that its **Status** has been set to **Enabled**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Manage Add-ons** window, verify that the **Access Panel Extension** has been installed and that its **Status** has been set to **Enabled**.

trans-unit.source: Verify that the Access Panel Extension is installed and enabled.
trans-unit.target: Verify that the Access Panel Extension is installed and enabled.
